org.assimbly.connector

Interface Connector

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseConnector, CamelConnector

    public interface Connector
     This interface is meant to configure and manage a connector.

 A Connector is a collection of flows.
 A Flow connects one or more endpoints for example a database and a directory.
 
 Each flow configuration consists of a Treemap<key,value>. The connector configuration
 consists of a list of flow configurations.

 For a valid flow configuration see
 https://github.com/assimbly/connector

      • setConfiguration

        void setConfiguration(java.util.List<java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> configuration)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets the connector configuration from a list of flow configurations (TreeMaps). This list is cleared after a connector is reinitialized.
        Parameters:
        configuration - list of flow configurations (Treemaps)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if configuration can't be set

                                                                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Converts a XML configuration to a connector configuration (list of flow configurations)
        Parameters:

        configurationUri - URI to the XML configuration (This can be a file location or an URL)
        Returns:
        returns connector configuration (List of flow configurations)

      • start

        void start()
    throws java.lang.Exception
        Starts a connector. The connector acts like a container for flows. After starting it can be configured
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if connector doesn't start
